title: How to Design a Mudroom With Lockers

steps.headline: Consider placing four individual lockers with organizers and shelves inside for shoes, hanging coats, and bag storage.
Include a window seat for putting on/taking off shoes, as well as a comfy place to hang out and read.
Create a drop-off zone with a corkboard message center.
steps.description: It's a great place for storing mail and the inevitable "junk drawer". You can also add electric in the drawers so phones/iPods can be charged out of sight!

steps.headline: Use 1x4 trim painted white - Typically a fancier door casing is used, but this plain casing made a better statement in the mudroom.
Install beadboard wainscot throughout the area.
steps.description: This protects the walls and gives it a true mudroom look. This beadboard was about 6' high with a 1x4 trim piece at the top. Add hooks to the trim piece for coats/pet supplies!

steps.headline: Finish the window seat.
steps.description: This comfy spot was finished off with beadboard and a painted seat with cushions.

steps.headline: Choose a tile floor.
steps.description: A durable floor that is easily cleanable is a key component to this space. Use your imagination when picking tile. Choose a nice light color, then make a tile "rug" with a mosaic border and tiles on the diagonal inside the border.

steps.headline: Create a special ceiling treatment.
steps.description: Attach tin squares to a thin piece of plywood then nail it to the beams in the ceiling. A little chair rail border around the edges, and you have a beautiful ceiling treatment!

steps.headline: Choose your paint color.
steps.description: Choose a warm color that highlights the tones of your tile.
